intro: Noccaea speluncarum, commonly known as the cave kidneyweed, is a rare and elusive plant species adapted to grow in dark, humid environments such as caves and rock crevices. It is characterized by its small, kidney-shaped leaves and pale green or almost white flowers, which are often hidden from direct sunlight. The plant has a robust root system that helps it anchor in nutrient-poor substrates. Its survival depends on specific microclimatic conditions, making it highly sensitive to environmental changes. Due to its limited distribution and specialized habitat, Noccaea speluncarum is considered a rare and endangered species.
